subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 778
msgSnippet: ... This seems to me tantmount to saying that something is wrong with agressive refactoring promoted by the XP process. I change interfaces all the time, but I
messageBody:
On Sat, 22 Feb 2003, Lauren Bish wrote:

> Well of course, all things need to change from time to time, and should be
> allowed to do so - but constantly changing interfaces, or interfaces that
> change drastically, are an indication that there is something wrong - either
> in the process or in the code.

This seems to me tantmount to saying that something is wrong with
agressive refactoring promoted by the XP process.

I change interfaces all the time, but I consider this to be something
right, not something wrong. I think my process is good because I don't
need to consider whether an interface I'm developing now will be
workable in the future; I just need to get it to work with what I need
now--a much simpler and faster job--and leave it at that. And it's good
for my code because it keeps my code smaller, more easily modifiable,
and less likely to have bugs.

cjs
--
Curt Sampson <cjs@...> +81 90 7737 2974 http://www.netbsd.org
Don't you know, in this new Dark Age, we're all light. --XTC
